snippet: Many companies are borrowing money for projects using tax-exempt bonds called qualified private activity bonds, costing federal taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars.
abstract: Many companies are borrowing money for projects using tax-exempt bonds called qualified private activity bonds, costing federal taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars; valuable perk amounts to stealth subsidy for private enterprise, as bonds are more conventionally used by cities and states to pay for public works.

byline.original: By MARY WILLIAMS WALSH and LOUISE STORY

lead_paragraph: Many companies are borrowing money for projects using tax-exempt bonds called qualified private activity bonds, costing federal taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars.

headline.seo: Qualified Private Activity Bonds Come Under New Scrutiny
headline.main: A Stealth Tax Subsidy for Business Faces New Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: A Stealthy Subsidy Aiding Big Businesses Is Growing
